content: necessity i m tired of having cold ears it s designed to be long enough to pull down over your ears or pushed up further and allowed to slouch it s the perfect pattern for using up all those scraps of leftover yarn have fun playing with your colours the brim of this hat is worked in st st and the edge is allowed to roll if you wish to have a snugger brim work a smaller number of stitches but work a round of increases to get the correct st count for the body of the hat remember that you can make this hat your own by varying the size of the stripes to suit the yarn you have to hand techniques & stitch patterns helical stripes helical stripes are used to create a jogless single round stipe using 2 colours you will change the yarn on every round to start helical stripes join a new colour as standard and then when you reach 3 sts before the first colour sl 3 sts pwise *drop the yarn are working with pick up the yarn from the round below it will be attached to the first st on your right needle and begin working the next round stop when you reach 3 sts before start of the previous colour sl 3 sts pwise repeat from * until you have completed your helical stripes watch of video of how to work this here https //youtu be/w1u27azfq2g helical stripe 5 break c4 using felted join to join c6 begin working helical stripes alternating c5 with c6 every other round until work from start of c6 is approx 1 25 / 3 cm break c5 the remainder of the hat will be worked in c6 only crown switch to dpns when necessary as crown decreases if using smaller circ knit 4 rnds even set-up round k18 19 20 pm 5 times knit to end of round decrease round *knit to 2 sts before m k2tog sl m repeat from * 5 more times 6 sts decrease d work decrease round 16 17 18 more times 6 6 6 sts remain break yarn with tapestry needle draw yarn tail through remaining sts tighten and fasten finishing weave in loose ends pattern block hat to dimensions given taking care not to stretch brim brim out of shape use your preferred method of working in the round small circular magic loop or dpns using the appropriate needle helly v1 2017-12-17 copyright 2017 carol feller with circ or dpns using c1 co 108
